encode_utils.profiles¶

Contains a Profile class for working with profiles on the ENCODE Portal. Note that the terms ‘profile’ and ‘schema’ are used interchangeably in this package.

encode_utils.profiles.DEBUG_LOGGER = <logging.Logger object>¶

A debug logging instance.

encode_utils.profiles.ERROR_LOGGER = <logging.Logger object>¶

An error logging instance.

exception encode_utils.profiles.UnknownProfile[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

Raised when the profile ID in question doesn’t match any known profile ID.

encode_utils.profiles.get_profiles()[source]¶

Creates a dictionary storing all public profiles on the Portal.

Returns:dict where each key is the profile’s ID, and each value is a given profile’s JSON schema. Each key is extracted from the profile’s id property, after a little formatting first. The formatting works by removing the ‘/profiles/’ prefix and the ‘.json’ suffix. For example, the value of the id property for the genetic_modification.json profile is /profiles/genetic_modification.json. The corresponding key in this dict is genetic_modification.
Return type:dict
class encode_utils.profiles.Profile(profile_id)[source]¶

Encapsulates knowledge about the existing profiles on the Portal and contains useful methods for working with a given profile.

A defining purpose of this class is to validate the profile ID specified in a POST payload passed to encode_utils.connection.Connection.post(). This class is used to ensure that the profile specified there is a known profile on the Portal.

Parameters:profile_id – str. Typically the value of a record’s @id property. It will be normalized to match the syntax of the profile ID keys in the dict encode_utils.profiles.Profile.PROFILES (which is set to the return value of the function encode_utils.profiles.Profile). You can also pass in the pre-normalized profile ID.
AWARDLESS_PROFILE_IDS = [u'lab', u'image', u'analysis_step_version', u'analysis_step', u'access_key_admin', u'platform', u'treatment', u'source', u'replicate', u'software_version', u'analysis_step_run', u'award', u'user', u'target', u'organism']¶

List of profile IDs that don’t have the award and lab properties. Consulted in encode_utils.connection.Connection.post() to determine whether to set defaults for the lab and award properties of a given profile.

FILE_PROFILE_ID = 'file'¶

Constant storing the file.json profile’s ID. This is asserted for inclusion in Profile.PROFILES.

SUBMITTED_FILE_PROP_NAME = 'submitted_file_name'¶

Constant storing a property name of the file.json profile. The stored name is asserted for inclusion in the set of File properties.

MD5SUM_NAME_PROP_NAME = 'md5sum'¶

Constant storing a property name of the file.json profile. The stored name is asserted for inclusion in the set of File properties.

profile_id = u'trimming_quality_metric'¶

The normalized version of the passed-in profile_id to self.__init__(). The normalization is neccessary in order to match the format of the profile IDs in Profile.PROFILES.

_set_profile_id(profile_id)[source]¶

Normalizes the profile_id so that it matches the format of the profile IDs stored in Profile.PROFILES, and ensures that the normalized profile ID is a member of this list.

Parameters:profile_id – str. The value of the profile_id argument in self.__init__()``.
Returns:The normalized profile ID.
Return type:str
Raises:UnknownProfile – The normalized profile ID is not a member of the list Profile.PROFILES.
get_profile()[source]¶

Provides the JSON schema for the specified profile ID.

Returns:dict representing the profile’s JSON schema.
Return type:dict
